content:
Is there any standard procedure to visualize or trace the program that a tactic produces? For example, there are a lot of times that I don't understand why the simp tactic worked, and I would love to see the actual program that it produced.

Realize this is a bit of a tall order, but just wanted to check about any existing tooling here
You can #print YourTheoremName but seeing the terms that simp produces won't be helpful to you most likely.
Every tactic can be prefixed with the show_term tactic to output exactly what proof term it created.
Henrik's shows the entire declaration, which works too, but it's less fine-grained.
You can also see which lemmas simp applies and when by using set_option trace.Meta.Tactic.simp true.
or use simp? if you just want to know which lemmas it uses but not when
Daniel Geisz has marked this topic as resolved.
